docs.snippet: Almost none of the governor’s seasoned staff members are helping Mr. Trump in Ohio, which no candidate since 1964 has lost and still won the White House....
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost none of the governor’s seasoned staff members are helping Mr. Trump in Ohio, which no candidate since 1964 has lost and still won the White House.
docs.abstract: Almost none of Republican Gov John Kasich's senior political staffers have offered their services to Donald Trump in his battle against Hillary Clinton in Ohio; refusals follow bitter feud between Kasich and Trump that boiled over during nominating convention in Cleveland; strategists say Trump's tough  chances of success in Ohio rest more on his campaign's fundamental structural problems than on lack of Kasich's operatives.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Feud With John Kasich May Haunt Him in Ohio
headline.print_headline: In Must-Win Ohio, Trump’s Feud With Kasich Has Come Back to Haunt Him

docs.snippet: Leveling unusually harsh criticism against the military, Republican Donald Trump said Wednesday night that America's generals have been "reduced to rubble" under President Barack Obama and suggested he would fire some of them if he wins the presid...
docs.lead_paragraph: Leveling unusually harsh criticism against the military, Republican Donald Trump said Wednesday night that America's generals have been "reduced to rubble" under President Barack Obama and suggested he would fire some of them if he wins the presidency in November.

headline.main: Trump: US Generals 'Reduced to Rubble,' He'd Replace Some
headline.print_headline: Trump: US Generals 'Reduced to Rubble,' He'd Replace Some

docs.lead_paragraph: Even looking at a best-case scenario, Donald Trump’s immigration proposals aren’t worth the economic cost.
docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column says Donald J Trump's proposed wall along Mexican border to stem flow of illegal immigrants should not be built for cost reasons; points out immigration enforcement costs $30 billion annually; says demographic changes in Mexico have cut back on emigration.

headline.main: The Crumbling Case for a Mexican Border Wall
headline.print_headline: Thinking of a Wall, and Money Better Spent

docs.snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday strongly defended her government's handling of the flood of migrants that crossed into Germany last year, but conceded that more still needs to be done and that concerns that have led to increasing support for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday strongly defended her government's handling of the flood of migrants that crossed into Germany last year, but conceded that more still needs to be done and that concerns that have led to increasing support for an anti-immigrant nationalist party need to be taken seriously.

headline.main: Merkel: Migrant Situation in Germany 'Many Times Better'
headline.print_headline: Merkel: Migrant Situation in Germany 'Many Times Better'
